> > To get the teleporters to
> > work in the order I wanted them to go, I had to place themn in 
reverse
> > order, but the map file shows them in the correct order.

For example, I placed teleporters #1-#7, in order from 1 to 7, the 
order in which you teleport is 1,7,6,5,4,3,2.  If you place them in 
order from 7 to 1, the order in which you teleport is 1,2,3,4,5,6,7.  
Does that help?
 
> I'm not quite sure if that means the converter is not working right 
:)
> I take it the map file is whats open in the editor?
> *Looks confused*

I placed all the teleporters using the scenario editor.
> 
> > That brings me to another feature for the new scenario editor: 
ability
> > to take a set of teleporters and change the order in which they 
would
> > work.
> 
> That sounds useful, especially for long chains, and it shouldn't be 
very
> hard to do either.

The longest continous chain I've put together was 20 and that was for 
'The Weakest Link' and 'The Weakest Link 2'.  Going teleporter crazy 
is NOT a good idea unless there is an obvious pattern or you want to 
achieve the effect of a maze.

> I've added it to the editor file and I'll clean it up and upload it 
to the
> groups downloads area so others can see it.

Cool.
